data.title: Allow loading of ChromeLogic properties from YAML
data.body:
As opposed to having to add new properties to the widget and loading the values into those, then later having the `ChromeLogic` query the widget to get those.

Also allow mods to override the asset browser's supported file formats least so they can add their own file extensions.

data.title: Allow VS2015 to format solution file
data.body:
Allow VS to reorder entries in solution file.

Quick followup to #9659, see also #9696.

data.title: Cache self.ToLuaValue in ScriptTriggers
Ensure LuaValues are disposed
data.body:
Adding in these missing calls prevents these instances from having to be finalized.

[Diff ignoring whitespace](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9977/files?w=1)

data.title: Fix exceptions while loading mods
data.body: Fixes #9975

data.title: Error in debug.log because of missing mods/common/mod.yaml
data.body:
```
An exception occured while trying to load mod all:
System.Collections.Generic.KeyNotFoundException: The key was not present in the dictonary.
   at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.get_Item(TKey key)
   at OpenRA.Manifest..ctor(String mod) in \OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Manifest.cs:Zeile 104.
   at OpenRA.Manifest.LoadMods() in \OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Manifest.cs:Zeile 194.
An exception occured while trying to load mod common:
System.IO.FileNotFoundException: The file "\OpenRA\mods\common\mod.yaml" could not be found.
Filename: "\OpenRA\mods\common\mod.yaml"
   at System.IO.__Error.WinIOError(Int32 errorCode, String maybeFullPath)
   at System.IO.FileStream.Init(String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, Int32 rights, Boolean useRights, FileShare share, Int32 bufferSize, FileOptions options, SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES secAttrs, String msgPath, Boolean bFromProxy, Boolean useLongPath, Boolean checkHost)
   at System.IO.FileStream..ctor(String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, FileShare share, Int32 bufferSize, FileOptions options, String msgPath, Boolean bFromProxy, Boolean useLongPath, Boolean checkHost)
   at System.IO.StreamReader..ctor(String path, Encoding encoding, Boolean detectEncodingFromByteOrderMarks, Int32 bufferSize, Boolean checkHost)
   at System.IO.StreamReader..ctor(String path, Encoding encoding)
   at System.IO.File.InternalReadAllLines(String path, Encoding encoding)
   at System.IO.File.ReadAllLines(String path)
   at OpenRA.MiniYaml.FromFile(String path) in \OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\MiniYaml.cs:Zeile 251.
   at OpenRA.Manifest..ctor(String mod) in \OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Manifest.cs:Zeile 65.
   at OpenRA.Manifest.LoadMods() in \OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Manifest.cs:Zeile 194.
```

EDIT:

```
(antares79) abcdefg30: the first exception is because mods/all/mod.yaml is missing an RequiresMods: entry
```

Use the correct actions when orders are issued over the minimap.
The `Game.Settings.Game.MouseButtonPreference` settings are referenced.

This commit fixes #9965

data.body: Closes #9892.

data.title: MiniYaml.cs cleanups
data.body:
Fix/add some whitespace.
Rename some variables.

I'm working on _not_ trashing comments when we parse yaml files but this proved more difficult than I originally thought and I didn't want these cleanup commits to just sit and go to waste.

data.title: Made both barracks' doors exit to different cells
data.body: Small polish, but also prevents a single unit from blocking both doors.

data.title: War factory door seizure
data.body:
I'm not sure EXACTLY what was causing it but my theory is below. The war factor door was having a seizure. 
My theory is something moved into the way of the door JUST as a unit was created so it wasn't able to exit.

I dunno shit was going down pretty fast and hard.

data.title: Minimap orders don't work in the left click control scheme
data.body:
In the original C&C, you could select an unit, or a group of them and you could pilot them directly on the radar window, or order them to attack. Having such feature could nice, but in case, having even a "zoom" button that can let the user zoom in a particular area and giving order, avoiding the problem that the points are to small to locate, would help its usage.

So if you have to give an attack or patrol command, you can do that, without moving the main camera, and lose sight of what is going on there.

data.title: Suggestion: Support powers in RA should pause on low power
data.body:
Currently the soviet Spy plane and para support powers continue charging on low power. Although low power doesn't make sense to 'pause' them, if #9962 is addressed, it is only fair in terms of balance.

data.title: Play Takeoff/Landing sounds for Planes as well as Helicopters
data.body: Written to fix https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9891#issuecomment-154857048.

data.title: Suggestion: Hide GPS icons when player has low power
data.body:
The GPS launch count down is paused when the Allied tech centre has low power but once launched, GPS dots can be seen even when the player has low power.

This means that the only way to sneak attack allied players after this point is to destroy the tech centre. This reduces the effectiveness of attacking a players power supply.

data.title: Fix TS legacy tileset importer color regression.
data.body: Fixes #9907.

data.title: Idea for mechanics and ally husks
data.body:
Was playing RA multilayer the other day and one of my allies lost their MCV, I put a mechanic in to try to revive it, however, it came back as my unit, would be good if it remained their unit if the husk belongs to an ally. There have also been cases where I've wanted to allow an ally to capture my second construction yard, could be good to allow allies buildings to be captured, not sure whether this would be better if you explicitly allowed it, not doing so would open the game up to ally sabotage, which would take a lot of collaborative planning so might be worth allowing as a game tactic?
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/28144177-idea-for-mechanics-and-ally-husks?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Ra balance
data.body:
Erred on the side of caution with these changes but aimed to make each unit more unique. If they need buffed further / completely changed, feel free. The Tesla tank still needs its double zap.

General reasoning;
-Chronotank is now more viable at repetitive hit and run.
-Phase transport is better for flanking and deploying troops. LoS out-ranges a turret but not a coil.
-Tesla tank can now (soon to be burst) attack targets via drive-by and whilst retreating. 

Chronotank 
-charge time reduced from 20s to 12s 

Phase tank
-passengers increased from 3 to 4
-speed increased from 113 to 142 (matches APC)
-LoS increased from 6 to 7 cells (matches Tesla tank)

Tesla tank
-no longer needs to turn and face the enemy to fire
(Needs double zap)

data.title: GPS only shows icons for vehicles
data.body:
Playtest 20151031
GPS satelite only shows icons for vehicles (& not for infantry).

Also see #9953 (but this, or the new "defend" stance, does not appear to be the reason for #9953)

data.title: GPS - Fog of War - Unit Targeting
data.body: Long range units, such as artillery and V2s do not auto-target enemies within range when GPS ability is up, they will only fire if another unit has line of sight.  AI skirmish opponents seem to have no trouble targeting deep within the players base when they should not have line of sight. This was a change introduced with the playtest 20151031. You did not need active line of sight (cleared fog of war), just GPS was enough for artillery to fire on enemy units in previous releases.

data.title: MAD Tank deploy screen shake is inconsistent
data.body:
After deploying a MAD tank, when the screen shakes it's possible that the viewport gets shifted over time to the left, or the right, or properly stays centered.
